caption.title: Univariate distributions of summary statistics.
caption.p: Models arranged in order of complexity, as in Fig 3. For every simulation, three summary statistics are shown: peak time, maximum mean log 10 SPVL, and equilibrium mean log 10 SPVL. Peak time is the time at which the SPVL reaches its maximum for each simulation run (maximum mean log 10 SPVL). Equilibrium mean log 10 SPVL is taken by taking the mean log 10 SPVL value at t = 4000. Because the distribution of equilibrium mean log 10 SPVL (lower left panel) for the random-mixing model is very narrow, it has been replaced by a point in order to preserve the vertical axis scaling.
